meanings.definition: To undergo the process of decay or decomposition.
meanings.sent1: The fruit was putrefying in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: Leaves on the ground were slowly putrefying over time.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in my backpack was putrefying into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant colors of the painting were putrefying into dull shades.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage was putrefying, making it unbearable to be near.

meanings.definition: To cause to decay or decompose.
meanings.sent1: The bacteria were putrefying the food left out on the counter.
meanings.sent2: The damp conditions were putrefying the wooden fence.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was putrefying the teacher's lunch by hiding it in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The toxic chemicals were putrefying the soil, making it unsuitable for planting.
meanings.sent5: The neglect of the building was putrefying its structural integrity.
